intro: Tabernaemontana monopodialis, commonly known as the white star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Tabernaemontana monopodialis is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants.
